SEARCH
Package Networking

Class TCPClient

java.lang.Object
Networking.TCPClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
Communicator
class TCPClient extends Object implements Communicator
The TCPClient class implements the Communicator interface and represents a TCP client for network communication. It establishes a connection with a server, sends and receives packets, and handles server close events.
Author:
haotian

    • TCPClient

      public TCPClient(NetworkHandler handler) throws IOException

      Throws:

  • Method Details

    • Start

      public void Start()
      Starts the network handler by initiating the listening process and pinging.
      Specified by:
      Start in interface Communicator

    • StartPinging

      public void StartPinging()
      Starts pinging the server at regular intervals. This method sends a "PING" message to the server and checks for a response. If the server does not respond within the specified timeout, the connection is closed. The pinging process continues until the connection is closed or an error occurs.

    • startListening

      private void startListening()
      Starts listening for incoming packets on the network. This method runs asynchronously in a separate thread and continuously listens for incoming packets until the network connection is closed. When a packet is received, it checks if it is a valid packet or a control message. If it is a valid packet, it retrieves the corresponding network remote and calls its 'onRetrieve' method. If it is a control message indicating server closure or user kick, it stops the network connection accordingly.
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException - if the remote corresponding to the received packet is not found
      OptionalDataException - if there is an issue with the data being read
      StreamCorruptedException - if there is an issue with the stream being read
      IOException - if there is an issue with the input/output operations

    • SendPacket

      public void SendPacket(Packet packet)
      Sends a packet over the network.
      Specified by:
      SendPacket in interface Communicator
      Parameters:
      packet - the packet to be sent

    • Stop

      public void Stop()
      Stops the network handler. This method stops the network handler and closes the server with an unknown reason.
      Specified by:
      Stop in interface Communicator

    • Stop

      public void Stop(ServerCloseReason level)
      Stops the network handler and performs necessary cleanup operations.
      Parameters:
      level - the reason for closing the server
